recommendations: STAT Renal Function Labs: Obtain STAT renal function labs (eGFR, serum creatinine, BUN, potassium) with documented timestamps before any contrast-enhanced study.
Defer Contrast if Non-Emergent: If the clinical scenario is non-emergent, defer contrast-enhanced CT until renal function is known; consider non-contrast CT or MRI without gadolinium in the interim.

Emergency Protocol: If the situation is emergent (e.g., active hemorrhage), proceed with the lowest feasible contrast dose, employ split-bolus or reduced-volume techniques, and ensure aggressive IV hydration per KDIGO guidelines.
Clarify Indication: Clarify the specific clinical indication (e.g., liver lesion evaluation, trauma assessment, infection work-up) before selecting a protocol.
